definition: barley/to moo/to seek or obtain/old variant of 侔[mou2]/old variant of 眸[mou2]

sentences.english: Rent controls were introduced to prevent profiteering.
sentences.chinese: 为了防止牟取暴利而实行了租金管制。

sentences.english: The people will stop your profiteering schemes, and the people will win .
sentences.chinese: 人民将阻止你们牟取暴利的诡计，人民必胜。

sentences.english: First, how to curb profiteering in real estate business.
sentences.chinese: 第一，如何制止牟取暴利的房地产业务。

sentences.english: They adulterated the high-quality gold ornaments to reap fabulous profits.
sentences.chinese: 高档黄金饰品中掺假以牟取暴利。

sentences.english: Rent controls were introduced to prevent profiteering.
sentences.chinese: 为了防止牟取暴利因此实行了租金控制。

sentences.english: They become “profiteers” in the eyes of those hurt by rising prices.
sentences.chinese: 在涨价受害者眼里，商人变成了牟取暴利的奸商。

definition: to gain profit (by underhand means)/to exploit/exploitation
to gain profit (by underhand means)/to exploit/see also 謀取|谋取[mou2 qu3]
to resell at a profit/to speculate
to accumulate wealth/to rake in money
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
to fabricate excuses (idiom)/to concoct various items (e.g. to pad an expense account)
to pass off fish eyes for pearls/to pass off fake products as genuine (idiom)
to artificially inflate/to bid up (the price)
to feign/to pretend to be/to pass oneself off as
